name: Google Docs modules
title: Google Docs modules

children.text: After connecting to the Google Docs app, you can use the following modules to build your
Triggers when a new document is created or modified in a specific folder.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Select whether you want to watch created or modified documents.
Select the drive that contains the documents you want to watch.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select the folder that contains the documents you want to watch.
Set the maximum number of documents Make will return in one execution cycle.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Select the drive that contains the documents you want to list.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select the folder that contains the documents you want to list.
Set the maximum number of documents Make will return in one execution cycle.
Gets a content of a document.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Select to map the ID of the document you want to get or select the document from the dropdown menu.
Select the drive that contains the documents you want to get.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the document you want to retrieve.
Select if you want to include a content from documentation tabs.
Select the type of content you want to receive in the output.
For further mapping of filter objects in next modules, use
. The Inline Objects Array objects are sorted in the same order they appear in the document.
Creates a new Google document by adding the content in the HTML format.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Enter the name of a document.
Enter the content of a document. You can use HTML tags.
Select the drive you want to put a created document into.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select the folder where you want to save a document.
Select whether you want to add a header to a document.
Select whether you want to add a footer to a document.
Create a Document from a Template
Creates a copy of an existing template document and replaces any tags, for example,
. This module allows replacing images by new images with URLs.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Create a Document from a Template
Select to map the ID of the document you want to use as a template or select the document from the dropdown menu.
Select the drive you want to put a created document into.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the document you want to use as the template for the new document.
Tags  	  Enter the tag associated with the documentation template. Do not use {{}}.     Replaced Value  	  Enter the value of the tag.
Image Object ID: Enter the Image Object ID. To retrieve the ID, use the Get Content of a Document module. You can find the ID in Inline Object Array, in the module output.
Image URL: Enter the URL of the image that will replace the current image.
Enter the name for a new document.
Select the drive where you want to save the document.
Select the folder where you want to save a document.
Insert a Paragraph to a Document
Inserts or appends a new paragraph to an existing document.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Select to map the ID of the document for editing or select the document from the dropdown menu.
Select the drive you want to put a created document into.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the document you want to edit.
Select the way you want to insert a paragraph.
By appending to the body of the document
to append the text to the current document body:
Appended Text: Enter the text you want to append. Make copies the style of the new paragraph from the paragraph at the current insertion index, including lists and bullets.
By appending to the end of the segment
to insert the text to the header or the footer:
Header ID: Enter the header ID that you want to inset the text to.
Insert Text: Enter the text you want to insert.
Footer ID: Enter the footer ID that you want to insert the text to.
Insert Text: Enter the text you want to insert.
above, specify the location where you want to insert text.
Index: Enter the element index that you want to append the text to. To retrieve the ID, use the Get Content of a Document module. You can find the ID in the Body collection, in the module output.
Inserted Text: Enter the text you want to insert.
Select the header and footer where you want to insert the text content to and enter the very text.
Insert an Image to a Document
Inserts a new image with a URL to a document.
The maximum image size is 50 MB. The image resolution must not exceed 25 megapixels. Only PNG, JPEG, or GIF formats are supported.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Select to map the ID of the document for editing or select the document from the dropdown menu.
Select the drive that contains the documents you want to insert an image into. In the
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the document you want to edit.
Select the way you want to insert an image.
By appending to the body of the document
to append an image to the current document body:
Image URL: Enter the URL of the image you want to insert.
By appending to the end of the segment
to insert an image to the header or the footer:
Header ID: Enter the header ID that you want to inset the text to.
Image URL: Enter the URL of the image you want to insert.
Height Magnitude in Points: Define the height of the inserted image. The new image will keep the aspect ratio.
Width Magnitude in Points: Define the width of the inserted image. The new image will keep the aspect ratio.
Footer ID: Enter the footer ID that you want to inset the text to.
Image URL: Enter the URL of the image you want to insert.
Height Magnitude in Points: Define the height of the inserted image. The new image will keep the aspect ratio.
Width Magnitude in Points: Define the width of the inserted image. The new image will keep the aspect ratio.
above, specify the location where you want to insert the text.
Index: Enter the element index that you want to append the text to. To retrieve the ID, use the Get Content of a Document module. You can find the ID in the Body collection, in the module output.
Image URL: Enter the URL of the image you want to insert.
Select the header and footer where you want to insert the image to and enter the link to the image.
Replace an Image with a New Image
Replaces an existing image with a new image with a URL in the document. To fill the original image's bounds, the new image may be scaled or cropped.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Select to map the ID of the document for editing or select the document from the dropdown menu.
Select the drive that contains the documents with an image you want to replace. In the
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the document you want to edit.
Enter the URL of the new image that will replace the existing one. Make displays image bodies as per images order in the document.
Specify an image you want to replace alongside with a new image.
Image Object ID: Enter the Image Object ID. To retrieve the ID, use the Get Content of a Document module. You can find the ID in Inline Object Array, in the module output.
Image URL: Enter the URL of the image that will replace the current image.
Replace a Text in a Document
Replaces an old text by a new text in a document.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Select the drive that contains the documents with the text you want to replace. In the
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the document you want to edit.
Specify the text you want to replace alongside with a new text.
Old text to be replaced: Enter the text you want to replace.
New text to be inserted: Enter a new text.
Downloads a document to a required format.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Select the drive that contains the documents you want to download. In the
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the document you want to download.
Select the target file format of the downloaded document.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Select the drive that contains the documents you want to delete. In the
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the document you want to delete.
Performs an arbitrary authorized API call.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: For the list of available endpoints, refer to the
Select the HTTP method you want to use:
GET: To retrieve information for an entry.
POST: To create a new entry.
PUT: To update/replace an existing entry.
PATCH: To make a partial entry update.
Enter the desired request headers. You don't have to add authorization headers; we already did that for you.
Enter the body content for your API call.
Make All Links in a Document Clickable
Makes all links in a document clickable.

data.label: Google Docs
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Google Docs account.

children.text: Make All Links in a Document
Select to map the ID of the document that contains links or select the document from the dropdown menu.
Select the drive that contains the documents with links.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Use Domain Admin Access: Request the list of drives that require admin access.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
